required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Duloxetine in the Treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence(Uncontrolled Leakage of Urine)
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Duloxetine Compared With Placebo in the Treatment of Predominant Stress Urinary Incontinence

brief_summary.textblock: The study evaluates the effectiveness of duloxetine in reducing urinary incontinence occurrences in women due to physical stress(e.g. stomach pressure on bladder). Incontinence is the inability to control bladder function with leakage of urine.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare duloxetine 40 mg BID with placebo in the reduction of incontinence episode frequency(IEF). Study visits occur every two weeks in therapy phase.
Evaluate the effects of different regimens of dose escalation and tapering effects on incidence of most prevalent adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction of IEFs using standardized instruments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female outpatients > or = 18 years of age
- experience episodes of stress urinary incontinence
- must have an educational level and degree of understanding English
- are free of urinary tract infections
- can use the toilet independently
Exclusion Criteria:
- any in or outpatient surgery in the last six months
- suffer from severe constipation
- extension of any internal organs beyond vaginal opening
- currently breastfeeding
- any nervous diseases affecting normal urinary function
